documentation.text: @notice Stakeable is a contract who is ment to be inherited by other contract that wants Staking capabilities

@notice 
 stakes is used to keep track of the INDEX for the stakers in the stakes array
@notice Staked event is triggered whenever a user stakes tokens, address is indexed to make it filterable

documentation.text:
@notice
 withdrawStake takes in an amount and a index of the stake and will remove tokens from that stake
 Notice index of the stake is the users stake counter, starting at 0 for the first stake
 Will return the amount to MINT onto the acount
 Will also calculateStakeReward and reset timer

documentation.text:
@notice
 hasStake is used to check if a account has stakes and the total amount along with all the seperate stakes

Staked(address,uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Staked event is triggered whenever a user stakes tokens, address is indexed to make it filterable

hasStake(address).notice: hasStake is used to check if a account has stakes and the total amount along with all the seperate stakes

rewardPerHour().notice: rewardPerHour is 1000 because it is used to represent 0.001, since we only use integer numbers This will give users 0.1% reward for each staked token / H
